result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse O. Reno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse O. Reno is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse O. Reno was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  No contact w/victim.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse O. Reno in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Masan states Count 1 being dismissed. Count 2: DE pleas to battery. Victim for both cases (15CM88 and 15CM301) in court, wishes to make statment. Defense has no objection to written statement previously filed and no objection to verbal statement today. Victim witness coordinator reads statement for victim. Atty Ryan makes staement.   No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Atty Ryan recommends 2 years probation concurrent in each case but on bail jumping, 4 mos as condition of probation be served in Sauk County Jail. Atty Masana responds. Additional jail time not necessary. Agree to probation being in place and recommends one year probation and no jail time. DE makes statement. Court imposes sentence.
Count 1: Dismissed
Count 2:
$443 fine or costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
Probation of 2 years. 
Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 48 hours if one is received.  
No contact with victim.  
Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 10:00 am
Plea/sentencing hearing at 12-15-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Jesse O. Reno in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Masana states there is another case pending and matters will be resolved.  Requests plea and argued sentencing be set. in both matters.  Court advises Atty Masana to talk to Br 3.  Bond continued.
